Sentencas: Pr2CuO4 (PCO) is one of the compounds in the Ln(2)CuO(4) (Ln=Pr, Nd, and Sm) group, which exhibits a Ruddlesden-Popper structure.
Titulo: Synthesis of Pr2CuO4 powders by using a glycine nitrate combustion method for cathode application in intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: PCO powders were prepared using a glycine nitrate process for cathode application in an intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cell (IT-SOFC) and its properties were characterized using X-ray diffractometry, scanning electron microscopy, and alternating current impedance spectroscopy.
Titulo: Synthesis of Pr2CuO4 powders by using a glycine nitrate combustion method for cathode application in intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The PCO cathode demonstrated favorable chemical stability with the electrolyte material of Sm0.2Ce0.8O1.9 (SDC) under 1100 degrees C.
Titulo: Synthesis of Pr2CuO4 powders by using a glycine nitrate combustion method for cathode application in intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The calculated thermal expansion coefficient of PCO was 1.212 x 10(-5) K-1.
Titulo: Synthesis of Pr2CuO4 powders by using a glycine nitrate combustion method for cathode application in intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: To reduce the resistance further, the PCO powders were mixed with various wt% of SDC.
Titulo: Synthesis of Pr2CuO4 powders by using a glycine nitrate combustion method for cathode application in intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: PCO mixed with 10 wt% SDC exhibited the lowest area-specific resistance of 0.3505 Omega cm(2) for Ag/PCO-10 wt% SDC/SDC/Ag structure at 800 degrees C in air.
Titulo: Synthesis of Pr2CuO4 powders by using a glycine nitrate combustion method for cathode application in intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The maximal power density was obtained as 347.50 mW cm(-2).
Titulo: Synthesis of Pr2CuO4 powders by using a glycine nitrate combustion method for cathode application in intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: These results indicate that the PCO SDC composite is a promising candidate for cathode application in IT-SOFCs.
Titulo: Synthesis of Pr2CuO4 powders by using a glycine nitrate combustion method for cathode application in intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells
Synthesis of Pr2CuO4 powders by using a glycine nitrate combustion method for cathode application in intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells
